Coobah The Dog
The best dog in the world.
Tell Me More

About

Coobah's Story

  • Febraury 2, 2015

    Coobah's Humble Beginnings

    Hard to believe, but this adorable little pup was surrendered by his owner along with another larger cathoula. The owner claimed he was the larger dogs puppy, but after further examination the vet determined she had never had a litter. The mystery of his origin may never be solved. After a brief stint in the Jefferson Parish Animal Shelter, the newly named Scooter and his "mom" Kali, were taken in by the Catahoula Rescue.

  • July 2015

    Coobah finds his family.

    After lots of searching and research, Coobah's soon to be owner contacted the Catahoula Rescue to meet Kali. The couple already had a rambunctious kitten and had no interset is also getting a puppy. But alas, when Ashley arrived at the Petsmart parking lot to meet the dog, she was already adopted. Scooter, however, WAS available. The rescue lady then said "You can have a trial run and bring him to your home for 7 days. If it doesn't work out you can give him back." Ashley thought that sounded great and made the arrangements. She got him and explained to her husband who was still in bed after working until 6am. He looked at her and said "You just adopted our dog without me."

  • February 2017

    Big move to the French Quarter

    Coobah's first move (of many) was not very far. Just from the Marigny to the French Quarter. It did come with some perks. He was FINALLY allowed to go inside the bar where his dad worked since we now lived above it. AND Coobah had a balconey over looking the very busy Decatur street. He watched parades and peed on the downstairs neighbors! He has very fond memories of the French Quarter apartment.

  • July 2018

    HUGE move to Canada

    This move was a BIG one! Coobah's mom was going to school in Vancouver Canada! Coobah's brother flew out there with his mom, while he and his dad and uncle packed up a truck and drove! It was a crazy long time to spend in the car, especially considering he often gets carsick, but they made it with only one minor drive off the road. Luckily his new place in Canada also had a balconey and he was reunited after 6 long weeks away form his mom.

  • August 2019

    Back to the USA

    After mom finished (and won) school, the family debated where to go next. Coobah and his folks decided to regroup after a long and expensive year in Chicago. Coobah had been before and really loves his uncle so being close to him was the goal. In fact, they got super close and ended up living across the street! AND after about a year, Coobah's uncle Joe adopted Madi! Now not only does Coobah have his family and uncle around all the time, he also has a cousin and playmate! Covid and lockdown has gone right over Coobah's head frankly, and honestly has been a great time for him. Mom and Dad are around way more then before. Not to mention his mom's new obsession with camping means fun in the water and woods! Life is looking pretty good right now for Coobah.

  • And the
    Adventure
    Continues!
